org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.javascript
Class JavascriptConditionProcessor

java.lang.Object
  org.openadaptor.core.Component
      org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.javascript.JavascriptProcessor
          org.openadaptor.auxil.processor.javascript.JavascriptConditionProcessor
All Implemented Interfaces:
Administrable, IComponent, IDataProcessor
Deprecated. replaced by more flexible map based script processors: ScriptConditionProcessor

public class JavascriptConditionProcessor
extends JavascriptProcessor

Processor which uses the evaluated result of javascript to implement an if/then/else construct.
The evaluated javascript result returns true the 'then' processor is executed, otherwise the 'else' processor is executed. If the selected (then/else) processor is not configured, the record will pass through without further change.
Note: If the javascript does not return a Boolean result, a RuntimeException will be thrown.

Author:
higginse

validate

public void validate(java.util.List exceptions)
Deprecated. 
Checks that the mandatory properties have been set. Will call validate() on the super class to ensure that it's mandatory properties have also been set.

Although it's permissible to not define the then and else processors, we write out warnings to give the user some chance when debugging adaptors.

Specified by:
validate in interface IDataProcessor
Overrides:
validate in class JavascriptProcessor
Parameters:
exceptions - list of exceptions that any validation errors will be appended to

generateOutput

protected java.lang.Object[] generateOutput(JavascriptProcessor.JavascriptResult jsResult)
Deprecated. 
Invoke thenProcessor or ElseProcessor depending on the evaluation result of the supplied JavaScriptResult.
It will return the output of the called processor, or will wrap the result from the JavascriptResult in an Object[] if no processor has been configured.

Overrides:
generateOutput in class JavascriptProcessor
Throws:
ProcessingException - if a null was passed
